text:
Dear all, hope your UMII sessions are doing well; here we are trying to push a bit more the system (goal: having a reliable cellular resolution (that can be quantified!) along all the sample (mouse embryo E 11.5, pituitary glands,..Cleared with BABB/ECi - if possible!); I`m therefore using the dynamic focus (settings; zoom body with 2x/0.5 lens,  Zoom 3,2x, beam: 4 um, 1 side illumination (with 3 L-sheets), DF mode: blend,  step size: 1 um ;): good improvement in axial resolution, but sometimes I face some strange  “doubling effect”(cells visible twice..See image); So, I`m wondering: 1) do you have any quick solution for removing this doubling effect?. 2) what is the setting you use for having a good cellular resolution (with cells close each others, like CA1 in hippocampus),if possible(!!)?. 3) if you have it, do you think is essential to use the inifinity correct setup with on the following lens (12x/0.5 or 4x/0.35)?
Thanks for the feedback!  If you prefer a quick Zoom chat, I`m also available!
